name: Handspun Wool Yarn--Denim
description:
Need yarn to go with denim? Who doesn't?

Here is a skein of 100% wool yarn spun from one of my friend Howard's Border Leicester sheep. I have spun it differently from my other yarn so that rather than swirling colors, there is a heathery - tweedy - look to the colors.

And what colors: denim blue, ruby red tapering to rose, a touch of leaf green and grey that will go perfectly with denim.

Dyed only with Greener Shades environmental dye.

The yarn is thinner than my usual--more of a worsted weight-- and probably should be knit with a size 7 or size 8 needle.

There are 2 skeins of 80 yards, each priced at $16.

This yarn should wet-felt with no problems.

Thanks from all of us at KnoxFarmFiber.

name: Handspun Wool Yarn--Norma
description:
Jelly-bean-green swirls with grape in this new yarn from our sheep Norma.

These are Spring colors but not pale or subtle--they are bold and can stand up to anybody's weather watch!

The yarn is 100% wool that is handspun, hand dyed, single ply, bulky and full of energy.
You'll be able to knit a cowl or scarf, some fingerless gloves or mitts that will liven your wardrobe and keep you warm at the same time.

I would use at least a size 10 needle for knitting, but even larger may work better. Be sure to knit loosely so that the yarn is not choked and the color shows through your pattern. Convo me with any questions.

There are 2 skeins of 72 & 80 yards which I am combining into one listing of 152 yards for $30.

These skeins were dyed with "Greener Shades" eco-dyes only.

Remember that Norma's wool does not wet-felt. You may of course use it with great success in needle-felting.

Thanks from all of us at KnoxFarmFiber.

name: Handspun Wool Yarn--Howard
description:
Time for pink! Here is some new yarn guaranteed to make you reach for your needles. The bright pink swirls with garnet, smoky blue and palest pink.

The yarn is 100% wool from our neighbor Howard's Border Leicester sheep. It is handspun, hand dyed, single ply, high energy and bulky weight.

It has been dyed with Greener Shades, an eco-dye.

There are 2 smaller skeins listed together for a total of 116 yards.

If I were knitting with this yarn I would use a large needle--say a size 13 or more--and knit loosely so as to give the yarn plenty of room to show off its colors.

The yarn can be used to wet-felt or needle-felt with great success.

Thanks from all of us at KnoxFarmFiber.

name: Corespun Yarn--Rose and Merlot
description:
Corespun is not your Grandmother's yarn!

It's fun to spin and fun to work with. This corespun yarn combines wool from our sheep, mohair from our goats, ribbons and funky stash yarn all spun around a central cotton string.

This colorway is mainly a burgundy/purple with splashes of pink, teal and blue spun around the orange cotton string.

The result is a strong bulky yet soft yarn in a skein of 68 yards.

Use it as a trim on a bag, fringe for a scarf, with your stash for a hat, alone for a yarn necklace, in a wall hanging---or what ?? You'll know what to do with it. Convo me with any questions.

Thanks from all of us at KnoxFarmFiber.
